title: Customized Immersive Learning Program for Strengthening SDGs Leadership Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of sustainable development concepts
context.additional_context: Leadership competency development program for pre-service/in-service teachers to implement SDGs. Providing customized learning experiences based on academic-practical collaboration in university settings

learning_goals: Learners can design multidisciplinary collaboration strategies for achieving the SDGs and establish implementation plans.

Learners can apply public-private-civil partnership methods (e.g., MOU, joint working groups) to draft ≥3 project proposals addressing local issues (e.g., aging population, infrastructure shortages), achieving ≥80% suitability in peer/expert reviews.

Learners can analyze 3 sustainability conflict cases in VR immersive environments (energy development vs. ecosystem protection, plastic regulation vs. industrial interests, fair trade vs. local economy) and propose solutions scoring ≥4/5 in stakeholder negotiation simulations.

resources: Collaboration tools (online whiteboards, project management software)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
